intro: Hololeion maximowiczii var. fauriei, commonly known as the Fauré's hololeion, is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Gentianaceae, which includes many showy, often blue or purple-flowered species. The plant is characterized by its small, clustered flowers and hairy stems, typical of the genus Hololeion. It thrives in moist, shaded environments, often found in forest understories. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and potentially endangered species.
